title: MPH: If F1 wants equal engines, where does artificial competition stop?
summary: Fears that one engine manufacturer will dominate F1 from 2026 are likely to see strugglers allowed to catch up. If power units are to be artificially equalised, how much of a technical competition will it be? asksMark Hughes

qa_pairs.question: What is the primary concern regarding engine manufacturers in Formula 1 for the 2026 season?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: One engine manufacturer may dominate the sport.
wrong_options: All teams will use the same engine.
There will be no engine changes.

qa_pairs.question: What potential measure is being discussed to address performance disparities among teams in F1?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: Allowing strugglers to catch up through artificial equalization of power units.
wrong_options: Implementing a weight limit for all cars.
Reducing the number of races in a season.
Increasing the size of the fuel tank.

qa_pairs.question: What impact could artificially equalizing engines have on the technical competition in Formula 1?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: It may reduce the degree of technical competition among teams.
wrong_options: It will enhance the innovation of engine designs.
It will lead to a wider gap in performance.
It will increase costs for all teams.
